Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: M. Sparks
Reviews.Content: It has all kind of cool gadgets! The price can't be beat, either! We love the sliding feature with the hidden keyboard. It takes good pictures and has a nice large screen so everything is easy to see. The sound is good. It took a little while to get used to navigating around the menus and so forth, but it's not too difficult. The battery stays charged for really long periods and that's a HUGE plus. We would recommend this phone to other people in a heartbeat (and have, in fact)!

Reviews.Title: Pretty package, poor design
Reviews.Author: J. Scarborough
Reviews.Content: I had my Nokia 2720 about 2 weeks before returning it and have little good to say about it other than it seemed well made, had a solid feel and a reasonable battery life.For three reasons I decided to return it.1. The phone was black and shiny, sleek and attractive as long as no one had touched it since it was cleaned. Pick it up and use it a couple of times and it looked like a scuzzy mess. I would have been embarrassed to let anyone else see it closely, much less use it.2. The phone had a one button combination navigation and select(OK) key which was actually recessed slightly, making it difficult to use. It was all too easy to hit OK when trying to scroll, which I found somewhat annoying. It might have been usable, however, by someone with long fingernails or tiny little fingers. As a male with short fingernails, I could scroll down one-handed with no problem, using my thumb on the key. To scroll up or to either side reliably I had to hold the phone in one hand and use the back (nail) of a finger or thumb on the other hand to press the key. Otherwise I kept hitting OK. If you have a low frustration point or would like to be able to use your phone one-handed, you should consider another phone.3. I could have lived with the two deficiencies above. The straw that broke the camel's back was the ear speaker. Even in a reasonably quiet room at max volume it was difficult to hear well unless the speaker opening was positioned in precisely the right spot on my ear. Unfortunately, when I placed the phone to my ear in a natural, comfortable location, as I would do when answering a call, the opening was about an inch above the "right" spot and I couldn't hear squat. The "right" spot also irritated my ear after a few minutes. If you are going to be using your phone in a noisy environment (and who doesn't), you should consider another phone.In closing, I can't recommend this phone except perhaps as a wall hanging. It's mighty pretty when all polished up.

Reviews.Title: Reliable, Good features at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: M C
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone for $20 including a $28.00 TMobile prepaid airtime credit for a family member. It's been very reliable, solidly built, has a a decent camera. External website reviews are mainly positive, and you can't beat TMobile's prepaid plan if you're a light user of minutes. Once you reach Gold status (spend $100 prepaid) you get a 15% bonus and your service remains active for a whole year (you do need available minutes).From an external review site: The 2720 has an upgraded camera. Others features include an external display, speakerphone, Bluetooth, email, and FM radio.

Reviews.Title: what a good deal
Reviews.Author: Anthony M. Naro "marknaro"
Reviews.Content: as all ways with amazon you get taken care of all the way love doing buz with them

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE SPEAKER PHONE
Reviews.Author: Howard Fan
Reviews.Content: THIS PHONE'S SPEAKERPHONE IS TERRIBLE....Read on....I bought this phone for my Mom. She uses the speakerphone feature almost ALL the time.So, when researching a phone, this Nokia 2720 had some of the highest ratings for a speakerphone.The speakerphone part for the user of the phone is fine. But the person you are talking to with the phone (like when my Mom calls me) is TERRIBLE. There is a TON of background 'noise', usually sounding like she is holding the phone out her window as she's driving! It's bad.She can be sitting at home, at her desk, and the sound quality I hear on the other end is terrible.For that soul reason, I would not recommend this phone

Reviews.Title: hello...HEllo....HELLO???
Reviews.Author: E. Nelson "Wonderfully Happy"
Reviews.Content: This inexpensive phone has good features, except that it has a very slow response after pressing menu choices. (Press, wait...press, wait....)This delay in its operating system means that when the phone rings, I flip it open and have to say hello 3 times before the caller hears me.... Annoying!Finally, its voice volume is too low, even when set at highest level.

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2720 phone is lousy
Reviews.Author: Frank C "Frank"
Reviews.Content: I bought Nokia 2720 phone yesterday, did not try to use it until I got home. (1) The volume of the phone was so low that I could hardly hear the conversation even it is set at the highest volume. (2) The menu key includes a big square area above number panel. A very slim rim around the center square is where we push up, down, left and right for getting to the icons for set up. It takes someone with concentration adn long finger nails to be able to maneuver correctly. (3) Today, we went back to the same T-Mobile store. We went over 2 more Nokia 2720 phones with exactly the same issue. The sales representative told us that we could not try it any more. We could either take one of the Nokia 2720 phone as we had paid, or take a different model of phone but pay $10 re-stocking fee.I don't know how they could continue selling products like this poor qualiy, and not letting customers to exchange with restocking fee. I'm sure they must have lots of unhappy customer like I am. I do not recommend Nokia 2720 to anyone, and would not recommend T-Mobil either.Unhappy Frank in Chicago

Reviews.Title: not good
Reviews.Author: Shawntina Williams
Reviews.Content: I don't even give this phone a star at all. The phone doesn't work nor will it take SIM card.

Reviews.Title: Nokia 2720 Fold
Reviews.Author: vgamesx1
Reviews.Content: Its a nice phone for $20 - $30.But very disapponited, the restrictions T-moble put on this phone is awful.I can't do the simpliest things like delete the built in ring tones and games, for the extra 10MB or so. The phone its self only has 32MB of memory but still enough for your ringtones/music/custom applications.Speaking of applications they limit internet usage of anything you put on it, example I put skype IM on my phone and says "acess not set" and when I try to set it its blured out.I do recommend this phone to most people but I only would recommend buying the phone from Nokia or some other company, but if you want T-moble buy the phone from Noika then get the t-moble service.

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as a birthday gift for my 12 yo grandson.He loves it. No problems that I know of.

Reviews.Title: Good deal, but cannot operate it!
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Walls
Reviews.Content: It is a great phone with just about every detail and feature with a real nice price you can think of, but however, like all other complex gadgets that wants to live on their own, cannot (or is very difficult) to operate it!  i kinda gave up on this phone.

Reviews.Title: not too satisfied
Reviews.Author: A. Banta "ranch wife"
Reviews.Content: I bought one of these phones and started having minor problems within the first 6 weeks. Sometimes, I would click on a menu item and the phone would turn off. Other times the screen would get stuck in either horizontal or portrait. Today, (3 and a half months later) the screen just went black. Too late to return it, and my sim is locked for 6 months to this phone.  Would not buy another. *sigh*

Reviews.Title: Great!!!!!
Reviews.Author: gamer "matt stevens"
Reviews.Content: this cell phone is great for the price it comes with all the features as a expensive cell phone would comes with plus more!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: decent phone but buggy
Reviews.Author: T. Paulsen
Reviews.Content: The phone is well built but needs a major software update.Problems,* shuts off at random.* freezes when receiving a txt.* the button to go on the web can be activated easily.* when sliding the phone the screen wont always flip.* screen can freeze at random and discolor.its a solid phone, and you do get what you pay for and counting out the air card id say $20 for this phone sounds about right. look for a similar phone that doesn't have these problems, you will be much happier you did.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good!
Reviews.Author: Blazing Tartan
Reviews.Content: Really stylish phone with a super-clear display.  Works as intended!  :-)Only complaint is the funky layout for the numeric part of the slide-out keyboard--the "0" is in the wrong place which kinda throws me.

Reviews.Title: Good Solid GoPhone Feature Rich
Reviews.Author: L. Shea "Technology - Girlyteck"
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my niece as a Christmas gift, because her old go phone looked so ancient. I wanted her to feel like she had a good phone, even if her plan was pay as you go. She was VERY happy when she received the phone! She now feels like she has a "normal" phone to use and she loves that it has the camera and that she is able to send pictures to her online social accounts. She loves the flip design and how it looks. The keys are easy to use. The battery life is good. The camera is adequate, it doesn't have flash, so you need decent lighting, but it is pretty good quality IE: no pixelation, looks clear. If you don't want to spend big bucks on a phone, you can buy this one and use with any ATT Sim card as well, which helps if you are not eligible for an upgrade yet, or need a second line for something.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, great value, difficult to purchase from amazon
Reviews.Author: Lia
Reviews.Content: Has all the bells and whistles you or your teenager needs in order to communicate with others.  Unable to purchase from Amazon anylonger.  Purchase at Walmart.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone!!!
Reviews.Author: O. Hannah
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great phone...just wish more was touchscreen...but even without it, its  pretty sweet. 9/10.

Reviews.Title: Good phone, excellnet bargain.
Reviews.Author: cbeck44
Reviews.Content: Got the phone as a temporary, non-prepaid replacement for a broken phone not yet due for subsidy from AT&T.;  Only option was to buy a new one from AT&T; at expensive, non-subsidized cost or use this as a bridge until up for a new subsidized phone. Has worked fine, good battery life, fairly simple features.  For anyone suddenly stuck with no working phone and the need for a phone with a slide out keyboard and pocket size, this is a good deal.  The included prepaid minutes in this Amazon deal were credited to our existing AT&T; minutes making the phone's net cost a real bargain.  May not need to use the subsidized phone when it comes up...

Reviews.Title: Good Phone, Service...questionable
Reviews.Content: I bought the LG neon Go Phone from ATT as a starter phone. It was a good phone for the first day that I used it. But when I tried to set the passcode for my phone, it went all techy on me and locked my SIM card and it locked me out of my phone. I called ATT Customer Service for help, and told me, "We can not help you over the phone if you have a LG phone," the only way they could help me was if I had another phone with a SIM card slot. Well I didn't, so then they told me, "Take it to an ATT Corps. Store, you CANNOT take it to a retailer," well I was pretty ticked off because I didn't have an ATT Corps. Store in my area! I was finally satisfied when we finally returned it for a new one that same day!The hardware design is really good, and I liked the feel to the phone. The TOUCH DIAL feature was really good, but I wished it had a full touchscreen.I bought my Go Phone from Walmart and it came with $50 airtime included in the package. I liked that it came with that, but was not impressed when I could only choose a plan that didn't take money off my account each day. It was the 25 cents plan where every minute is 25 cents (even if its not a minute)! All I wanted to do was text basically on it, but my hopes and dreams were crushed when I found out with the "plan" I got, it would cost 20 cents for each text message I send AND receive! That was a real pain until I got 1000 messages for $10 that came off my airtime (you only get 30 days to use ALL of the messages or they are gone!).Another thing that I didn't really like about it was they charge you for SETTING UP YOUR OWN VOICEMAIL! So if you don't know how to set up a voicemail, then leave it! I spent $1.25 of my money just setting it up! I was really upset with ATT for doing that! You would think it was for free! WRONG! Then to for me to set up my account, they sent me a "Free Text message" from them!Overall I like the phone, hate the service! I use it basically to text now that I got 1000 messages. But that won't last long before I have to spend 10 bucks again just for a decent deal! DO NOT MESS WITH THE SECURITY SETTINGS UNLESS YOU KNOW WHAT YOU ARE DOING!I would recommend the phone to people who are just starting with cell phones, or just get a regular ATT plan! I am happy with the phone now because I got it all under control, but if you are not familiar with these kind of phones, DO NOT GET THEM! Read the plan features first before you buy them!If you do get a GO phone, then good for you! But my suggestion for those who want to text a lot, get the unlimited texting for 20 bucks a month (this also comes out of your airtime!).

Reviews.Title: Lg prepaid AT&T;
Reviews.Author: Mantlady- Woman of the West
Reviews.Content: Works well for my needs, which are minimal.  Screen is large enough.  Functionse well as basic cell phone.

Reviews.Title: just a waste
Reviews.Author: ian
Reviews.Content: You cant get minutes anywhere and other tmobile sim cards dont work. if you have to go prepaid go to wal-mart, at least theirs work for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: If I knew then what I know now
Reviews.Author: Abdul-Qahhar
Reviews.Content: The full QWERTY keyboard is really nice, but I would have liked to have known there was no auto complete. The call quality is fine and the battery life is pretty good (coming in at just under 4 hours) having said that, I am disappointed in the phones over all quality. It arrived on the 27th of August and today (a little over 2 weeks later) the screen has started going black at random intervals.

Reviews.Title: I love this phone!
Reviews.Author: J. B. Gramenz "Jessa Brooke"
Reviews.Content: I was so impatient getting it and was worried I wouldnt get it on the estimated date but UPS dropped it off at about seven and I didnt know they ran that late but I was soo happy.  I love this phone, it was a replacement and is perfect, I ran the battery dead the second day I had it but I played scrabble all day and kept tinkering with it so Im 100% sure thats why. The camera is great, a little tricky because you have to rotate the pictures a lot to use them for contact pictures or wallpaper. Ringtones sound good, picture is great.  I did read that people didnt like the snap cover over the battery but personally i love it, I dont have to worry about it popping off and I think its a great idea.  Other than that I am really happy, there is even an option for messaging to where the messages are in bubbles with contacts picture next to them. I would recommend this phone without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: My LG Neon Love it
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with my newcel Phone.  I was not happy that the introuction manual book DID NOT help. But With help from friends I was up and going.  Yes I am vary happy with my LG Neon cel phone.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Phone!
Reviews.Author: Erick S Sanchez
Reviews.Content: I love this phone has everything I need even has a touch dial to dial phone numbers !!Love my neon

Reviews.Title: LG NEON
Reviews.Author: David W. Leger
Reviews.Content: The LG NEON Go-Phone from At7T is an awful cellphone, the speaker quality is lousy which makes it difficult to hear while using the phone. I used AT&T; and was very unhappy with their poor customer service. I switched back to T-Mobile and was glad I did.

ProductInfo.Features:
Compact, affordable fold phone with external screen featuring hidden-till-lit mirror effect
Pay for just the minutes you use with no annual contract--easy refill via Internet or prepaid cards
1.3-megapixel camera/camcorder; access to personal e-mail and instant messaging services; personal organizer tools
Up to 4 hours of talk time, up to 200 hours (8.3 days) of standby time; released in November, 2009
What's in the Box: handset, rechargeable battery, charger, quick start guide
ProductInfo.Name: Nokia 2720 Prepaid Phone (T-Mobile)
